Lent II: The Anglican Communion

Tuesday 4 January 2005: "And did those Feet in Ancient Times..."

  • Lindisfarm, and the myth of Joseph of Arimethea.
  • Historical records of pre-establishment missions to northern Europe including Britain.
  • The Celtic church

Tuesday 11 January 2005: Sarum and Cantebury

  • The council of Whitby
  • Papal sponsorship of William the Conqueror
  • Contrasts between Norman/Roman doctrine, liturgy and religious; and Saxon/Celtic doctrine, liturgy and religious. The Canons and the Abbots.

Tuesday 18 January 2005: Henry and Anne

  • The Tudors, Latimer, Cranmer and Ridley; the 39/42 Articles.


Tuesday 25 January 2005: Good Order and Dignity

Church structure: governance and pastoral oversight, the ministries of Bishops, Priests, Deacons, and Laity.

Tuesday 1 February 2005: Highs and Lows

Highs and Lows: Methodism and the Oxford movement. The Anglican Communion today.


Tuesday 8 February 2005: The Anglican Communion today
